title: Wayfair Braces for Pandemic-Fueled Online Shopping Spree to Slow Down
sub_head: Active customer numbers have dropped about 13% as executives say people are returning to physical stores
body:
Wayfair Inc. is grappling not only with inflation denting consumersâ€™ spending power, but also people shifting their purchases to physical stores as Covid-19 pandemic restrictions ease.
During the first year of the coronavirus pandemic, the online furniture seller enjoyed a captive audience, as lockdowns kept shoppers indoors and focused on sprucing up their homes. It added millions of customers in 2020, and posted its first annual profit as a public company.
